title: EFRON & BROCKHAUS ENCYCLOPEDIC DICTIONARY
description:
This was the standard reference encyclopedia in the russian empire , in other words , the one read by people such as Tolstoy , Lenin or Mendeleiev.


   It is a pure Saint Petersbourg-creature , and was produced in collaboration with Brockhaus-Leipzig , the leading editorial enterprise in the Second Reich and perhaps all Europe (the same happened in the same days in Spain with the famous "Espasa")


   The present-day preeminence of the english language (and the destructions of 1914 onwards) has covered during a long time much of the european cultural treasure , and this has affected even so powerful a cultural regions as Germany , even France.

    The Efron is an invaluable historical source , and has no rival on east europe affairs , but has not yet been translated in any western language.








    The students of the russian language must of course remember the years of publication (1890-1907) , and therefore before the reforms of language and calendar carried about by the soviet government from 1917.

format: djvu
